primary_factors: No accumulating snow or active wintry precipitation expected (0" snowfall; no advisory/warning triggers)
Temperatures/wind chills are not in extreme-cold closure territory (feels-like ~+19°F during bus hours; no ≤-20°F signal from any credible source)
Primary risk is freezing fog/mist 4–9 AM: potentially very low visibility + patchy black ice on bridges/low spots (a delay trigger more than a closure trigger in Michigan)
No neighboring-district domino effect yet: FOX17 closings page shows no active closings/delays at time checked; community sentiment = no buzz
Roads broadly reported/assessed as clear; agencies in normal posture with likely spot-treatment only (not a plowing event); power-outage risk low with only small/scattered county-level outages
decision_rationale: All experts align that this is not a Michigan-style snow-day setup: forecast snowfall is 0, no meaningful wintry precip signal, winds are modest, and wind chills are far above the -15°F to -20°F danger band (and nowhere near the automatic ≤-20°F threshold). The only credible operational hazard is freezing fog/mist during the 4–9 AM window, which can create (1) pockets of near-zero visibility and (2) patchy black ice—especially on bridges/overpasses, shaded rural segments, and low-lying routes near wetlands/river bottoms. Historically in Kent County, that combination more often produces a 2-hour delay (if anything) rather than a full closure unless visibility is widespread <0.25 mi and/or incidents spike before dispatch. News intelligence shows no neighboring district closures and no closure messaging from Rockford Public Schools at this time; infrastructure status suggests roads are generally clear with routine spot-treatment. Power-grid conditions do not indicate a widespread outage driver. Net: full closure remains unlikely; the practical risk is a short-notice delay decision around 5:45–6:15 AM if dense fog verifies broadly.

collaboration.summary: Agents reached consensus after 1 round(s) with 1.0% spread. Average probability: 6%.
